DOC.HEADLINE: ORANGE COUNTY BRIEFLY : FLUOR SUBSIDIARY TO WORK_ON FUEL_CELL POWER_PLANTS
DOC.TEXT: Fluor Corp. ' s Fluor Daniel Inc. subsidiary and a unit of Energy Research Corp . in Danbury , Conn. , said Monday they have signed an agreement to cooperate on commercial development of fuel_cell power_plants . Financial terms were not disclosed . The companies have agreed to cooperate on sales , installation and support services , development of international markets and securing financing for demonstration projects . Direct fuel_cell power_plants produce electricity by combining hydrogen in the fuel with oxygen in the air to produce electricity and water . There are virtually no toxic emissions because the fuel isn ' t burned . Current models use natural_gas as fuel , although alternative fuels , such_as ethanol and coal-derived gas , are being studied . The two companies are working_on a demonstration project in Santa Clara that would be capable of supplying electricity to 1 # 500 homes .
